resources.string:

\u2022Runny nose

\u2022Fatigue

\u2022Bloody diarrhoea
\u2022Abdominal pain
\u2022Cramps
\u2022Fever
\u2022A general feeling of discomfort
\u2022Inability to empty bowels
\u2022Indigestion
\u2022Nausea
\u2022Vomiting
\u2022Flatulence

\u2022Yellowing of the eyes
\u2022Fatigue
\u2022Loss of appetite
\u2022General feeling of discomfort
\u2022Abdominal pain
\u2022Dark urine
\u2022Itching
\u2022Swelling

\u2022Loss of appetite
\u2022Nausea
\u2022Vomiting
\u2022Rashes
\u2022Easy bruising
\u2022Headache
\u2022Sore throat

\u2022Muscle Ache
\u2022Chills
\u2022Fatigue
\u2022Fever
\u2022Malaise
\u2022Shivering
\u2022Sweating
\u2022Fast heart rate
\u2022Headache
\u2022Nausea
\u2022Unhealthy pale appearance

\u2022High fever
\u2022Chills
\u2022Severe diarrhoea
\u2022Headache

\u2022Abdominal pain
\u2022Chills
\u2022Fever
\u2022Loss of appetite
\u2022General feeling of discomfort
\u2022Nausea
\u2022Vomiting
\u2022Abdominal tenderness

Gastroenteritis


\u2022Stomach pain
\u2022Uneasiness of the stomach - vomiting
\u2022Decreased body weight
\u2022Sore to touch
\u2022Yellow eyes, like jaundice
\u2022Fever
\u2022Muscle pain
\u2022Retching sensation

\u2022Dehydration
\u2022Dry mouth
\u2022feeling weak
\u2022Diarrhoea
\u2022Vomiting
\u2022Fever
\u2022Hunger
\u2022Stomach pain

\u2022Cough

\u2022Fever
\u2022Chills

\u2022Phlegm while coughing
\u2022Fatigue
\u2022Tiredness
\u2022Headache
\u2022Dizziness
\u2022Muscle pain
\u2022Loss of appetite

\u2022Uneasiness
\u2022Vomiting
\u2022Diarrhoea
\u2022Loss of appetite
\u2022Indigestion
\u2022Weakness
\u2022Dizziness
\u2022Tiredness
\u2022Stomach pain
\u2022Fevers
\u2022Dehydration

Gastritis


\u2022Stomach pain
\u2022Vomiting
\u2022Uneasiness
\u2022Dizziness
\u2022Loss of appetite
\u2022Indigestion

Conjunctivitis


\u2022Redness in one or both eyes
\u2022Itchiness in one or both eyes
\u2022A gritty feeling in one or both eyes
\u2022A discharge in one or both eyes that forms a crust during the night that may prevent your eye or eyes from opening in the morning
\u2022Tearing

Encephalitis


\u2022Headache
\u2022Fever
\u2022Aches in muscles or joints
\u2022Fatigue or weakness
\u2022Confusion, agitation or hallucinations
\u2022Seizures
\u2022Loss of sensation or paralysis in certain areas of the face or body
\u2022Muscle weakness
\u2022Problems with speech or hearing
\u2022Loss of consciousness

string-array.name: questions
string-array.item: Have you had a blocked nose?
Has there been blood in your diarrhoea?
Have you had pain in or near your stomach?
Are you unable to pass stool?
Do you have an uneasy feeling in your stomach, usually after eating?
Do you feel that you have a buildup of gas in your stomach?
Have you been having an uneasy sensation to vomit?
Do your eyes seem to be yellow?
Have you not been eating properly?
Is your urine darker than usual?
Is any part of your body swollen?
Have you noticed rashes on your body?
Have you noticed that you get bruises easily?
Do you have a sore throat?
Have you been sweating more than usual?
Is your heart beating fast, even at rest?
Do you feel pain when you touch/press around your stomach?
Have you noticed yourself losing weight in the duration of your sickness?
Have you had a sensation to vomit, but were unable to?
Have you been feeling weak, and feeling thirsty?
Have you noticed your mouth getting dry?
Are you eyes redder than usual?
Is there some discharge on your eyelids in the morning?
Have you experienced a loss of sensation in any part of your body?
Have you been confused, or had hallucinations?
Have you been sweating profusely, especially in the night?

resources.string: Hello, and thanks for using the Dr. Robot app!! Dr. Robot is a tool meant for preliminary diagnosis, i.e., you yourself can check if you have a disease in case you have felt under the weather. It works by asking you a series of questions, and narrowing down on a disease you might have, depending on your responses.

DR. ROBOT IS AN APP. IN NO WAY CAN IT REPLACE PROFESSIONAL MEDICAL ADVICE FROM A DOCTOR OR NURSE. PLEASE CONSULT A DOCTOR IN CASE YOUR SYMPTOMS HAVE BECOME WORSE, OR YOU HAVE BEEN DIAGNOSED WITH A SERIOUS DISEASE. PLEASE DO NOT CONSUME MEDICINES BASED ON THE DIAGNOSIS WITHOUT A DOCTOR\'S PRESCRIPTION. AS MENTIONED, DR. ROBOT HELPS IN PRELIMINARY DIAGNOSIS; IT CAN DIAGNOSE YOU BASED ON SYMPTOMS YOU HAVE EXPERIENCED. IT DOES NOT TAKE INTO ACCOUNT ANY UNDERLYING CONDITIONS, OR RANGES OF TIME FOR WHICH THE SYMPTOMS HAVE BEEN PREVALENT.
1) You are here since you have successfully signed up with your credentials. Note that you can change your password, email address etc. using Settings.

2) Click on \'Perform a quick diagnosis\' in the drawer menu. You will be prompted to add symptoms. Please add atleast 3 and atmost 5 symptoms, and restrict them to those prompted by the autocomplete options. You can check out all the symptoms in the \'Learn more\' section in the menu. Click the \'Diagnose\' button to submit your symptoms.

3) From there, pairs of questions will be asked, and you are simply required to answer Yes/No. If you are unsure whether you have the symptom, ask someone who has observed you through the course of your sickness. The number of questions asked depends on the responses you give; please do not be alarmed if too many questions are being thrown at you!
4) The app will inform you of its decision, as soon as it has narrowed it down from the list of diseases. You can check previous diagnoses from the \'History\' option in the menu.
The Dr. Robot app was created and is maintained by Poorna Chandra Tejasvi, Manas Deka, and Bryan Robert.
To send feedback about the app, fill out the form below
Dr. Robot thinks you may have...
